title: Insert Operations
subject: MongoDB
theory: Insert operations add new documents to a collection. You can insert one or multiple documents. If the collection does not exist, insert operations create the collection.

examples.explanation: Inserts a single document. If _id 1 exists, throws duplicate key error.

common_mistakes.correction: Ensure _id is unique. Using the default ObjectId prevents this.

interview_questions.question: What happens if one document fails in insertMany({ ordered: false })?
interview_questions.answer: MongoDB continues to insert the remaining documents. Default is true (stop on error).

practice_problems.problem: Insert three distinct products into a 'products' collection.

real_world_use_cases.description: Rapidly inserting thousands of log entries using unordered bulk insert for performance.

summary: Efficiently adding data is the first interaction with any database system.
